com.yantra.yfs.japi

Interface YFSConnectionHolder


  • public interface YFSConnectionHolder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.sql.Connection getDBConnection()
      This returns a connection object that can be used by user exits, custom agents and event handlers.

    • Method Detail

      • getDBConnection

        java.sql.Connection getDBConnection()
        This returns a connection object that can be used by user exits, custom agents and event handlers. The code inside user exits, custom agents and event handlers has to cast the YFSEnvironment handle to this interface, and retrieve a DB connection using this method.

        The user-exit programmer, custom agent programmer or the event handler programmer should not commit or rollback or close this connection. The intent is to keep the user-exit code, custom agent code and the event-handler code within the same commitment boundary as the containing transaction. Executing a commit, rollback or close on this connection may result in undefined behavior. This connection object can be used to perform all other utility DB operations that may be needed within a user exit, custom agent or an event handler, such as db selects or db updates. It should be remebered that the final commit or rollback will be handled by the containing transactions, and the user should never take this up as his responsibility a Connection a connection object
